en.use:
Used in patients over five years of age presenting with acute diarrhea. 

The score includes the following clinical signs: eye level, skin pinch, respiration depth, radial pulse, and urine output. 
A total score greater than 6 would be categorized as having severe dehydration, a total score of 4-6 would categorize the patient as having some dehydration, and a total score less than 4 would categorize the patient as having no dehydration.
en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the total sum for the simplified NIRUDAK score.
en.misuse: Not to be used for assessment of the full NIRUDAK score or the age-specific NIRUDAK score.
